issues.description: The UML in the problem statement indicates the Farm.animals attribute is private ("- animals: List<Animal]") and the text explicitly asks students to provide a getter and setter for the list. In the solution repository Farm.java the field is declared public (public List<Animal> animals;). Exposing the field publicly contradicts the intended encapsulation described in the specification and the UML and may confuse students about whether they should implement/get/set the field or leave it public.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the Farm.animals field private to match the UML and the instruction to provide getter and setter (e.g. change to 'private List<Animal> animals;'), keep the existing getAnimals()/setAnimals() methods, and initialize the list in the no-argument constructor. This preserves encapsulation and removes ambiguity for students.
